workout_file.description: Foundation training: Relatively low intensity ride with goal of spending a large proportion of the ride into Endurance Zone 2.
workout_file.name: Week 3.3 - Foundation

textevent.message: Another Foundation day for the 6 Week Beginner FTP Builder on tap for today!
Let's get the legs turning over and start warming up here. We'll catch up in a few minutes once you're settled.
So, we've done Foundation workouts a few times now in this plan, and today's goal will be no different.
We're after a relatively low intensity ride with the goal of spending a large proportion of the ride in Endurance Zone 2.
Today, we'll also respect our progressive overload plan cornerstone and reduce the rest between intervals by 1min.
This means our intervals will be 6 times, 6mins zone 2, with 1min rest between, as opposed to 2mins rest last week.
That should be more than doable for you still, considering the bulk of the day is low intensity at zone 2.
1min to go, then we're headed right into our main set.
Make sure you have your bottles, towel, and fan all good to go.
All right, let's start off between 90-100 RPM for this first interval.
Steady the effort now, but lift your cadence up just a bit more, and let's find that familiar rhythm here.
Remember, using a faster cadence helps utilize more slow twitch muscle fibers, which is another goal for an FTP program.
That's halfway through! If you're at 90 RPM now, try to aim closer to 95-100 RPM for these last 3 mins.
Try to get out of your comfort zone a little bit :-)
Final minute here! Keep that cadence up!
In 10sec, we're taking a very short 1min recovery...Use it well!
Great effort! Bring the cadence and effort down and let's take a very quick rest.
We're aiming for 100+ RPM next for the entire interval!
Prepare to get those legs spinning next :-)
Let's make it happen here! Bring the cadence way up, but prevent any bouncing in the saddle.
Is your backside planted in the saddle? Make sure you're not sacrificing form for cadence.
That's halfway through! Keep it up, and don't let your cadence drop off now.
Keep the leg speed high for this final minute, and if you can, bring it up another 2-3 RPM.
Great work! We'll take a very quick 60sec recovery again here.
Next up, we'll do a progressively faster cadence interval ranging from 90-100 RPM.
We'll keep the power steady throughout though :-)
All right, let's start at 90 RPM for these first 2mins. Steady as you go here.
Next up, we're going to lift the cadence slightly to 95 RPM.
Give me a little more leg speed now, but keep your form solid here.
Our last step is going to be at 100 RPM, and we'll start that in 30sec.
Here we go, FAST FEET!
Keep your hips planted on the saddle, no bouncing here.
30sec left! Keep that cadence up!
You're doing great so far today! That's 3 down, and 3 to go. Let's take a quick break again here.
Next up, we'll do some alternating intervals with 1min at 90 RPM, and 1min at 100 RPM.
Ready? We're starting off at 90 RPM here.
Leg speed up just a touch here. I want to alternate 90 RPM and 100 RPM each minute for this interval.
Get ready for 100 RPM in 10sec.
Even faster cadence now. Don't lose your form, though, or get sloppy here.
And back down to 90 RPM again, was that 100 RPM minute tough? If so, practice makes perfect!
Back up to 100 RPM again! This is halfway through this 2nd interval.
Slowly bring the cadence down to 90 RPM again, 2mins to go!
Fast feet for this final minute! Spin those legs!
Keep the cadence up to the arch!
Beautiful! Quick rest again here. Just 2 intervals left today!
Our next effort is going to be steady at 90-100 RPM again, nothing too fancy :-)
Okay, lift your cadence up to 90-100 RPM and let's get into this 5th interval!
Keep your cadence up here. Don't lose your form as you fatigue either.
That's halfway through! If you're at 90 RPM now, try to aim closer to 95-100 RPM for these last 3 mins.
Final minute here! Keep that cadence up!
BOOM! Just 1 more interval left today, you're doing awesome here!
This final effort is going to be a high cadence effort from start to finish!
Aim for 100+ RPM here, then we'll put this workout to bed!
Let's make it happen here! Bring the cadence way up, but prevent any bouncing in the saddle.
Now, aim for consistency in your cadence and form right to the end!
That's halfway through! Keep it up, and don't let your cadence drop off now.
Keep the leg speed high for this final minute, and if you can, bring it up another 2-3 RPM.
Way to get it done today, my friend! That's a solid workout in under an hour.
We'll spend a few more minutes cooling down, then do your best recovering and refueling for the next workout!
See you next time :-)
